ol.li: See what’s new in the city

div.class: inner col col24 first last id2b50df7c-38df-41bd-931f-522a98a2c7a1

img.alt: Red Navy Modern Labor Day Facebook Post

h4.a: City Offices Closed for Labor Day, September 2

div.div: City Offices will be closed in honor of Labor Day, September 2. Regular hours will resume on Tuesday, September 3. The City Council will meet on Tuesday, September 3, at 7 pm.

img.alt: Paint Pasco Logo and Apply Now This Mural Reimbursement Program is designed to enhance the aesthetic

div.div: This Mural Reimbursement Program is designed to enhance the aesthetic appeal of Downtown Pasco, support local artists, and promote cultural expression. Read on...

The City is making significant safety improvements to Sylvester Street, transforming it into a more accessible and safer roadway for all. Construction is well underway. Stay informed by checking out our dedicated Sylvester Street Safety Improvements page! Read on...

Join us for a day of fiery fun at the Fiery Foods Festival on September 14th at Peanuts Park. Enjoy a variety of spicy foods, live entertainment, kid-friendly activities, and the famous pepper-eating contest. Read on...

h4.a: Join the Adventure: Pasco's Pepper Pack Journey

div.div: This summer, the City is spicing things up with an exciting new initiative that combines community engagement with a dash of playful competitionâ€”introducing the Pepper Pack Journey, a city-wide scavenger hunt that not only promises fun and adventure. Read on...

h4.a: Road 68 and West Court Street Roundabout Construction

div.div: Road 68 at the north end of the intersection will be closed until mid-September for the construction of a new roundabout. Read on...

h4.a: Partnerships in Broadmoor Area Propel Improvements

div.div: The City of Pasco is excited to announce a transformative partnership with the Pasco Public Facilities District (PFD) and Broadmoor Properties to enhance infrastructure and foster economic growth in the Broadmoor Area. Read on...

Discover an array of fresh, locally grown produce, flowers, and handcrafted goods. The market is open every Saturday from 9 am to 1 pm through October. Visit us for a taste of Pasco's local flavor and vibrant community spirit! Additional Info...
